Com novo 'triple-double' de LeBron, Lakers superam Spurs
Foi o 5º triunfo seguido do time de Los Angeles
04 Nov 2019, 16:45 by Estadão Conteúdo
O Los Angeles Lakers voltou a contar com o brilho da sua dupla de astros para vencer na temporada 2019/2020 da NBA. Pela rodada de domingo (3), a equipe superou o San Antonio Spurs por 103 a 96, fora de casa, com 25 pontos e 11 rebotes de Anthony Davis, além de 21 pontos, 13 assistência e 11 rebotes de LeBron James.
LeBron, assim, voltou a registrar um "triple-double", como havia ocorrido na sexta-feira (1º), em triunfo sobre o Dallas Mavericks, definido na prorrogação. E Dwight Howard, com 14 pontos e 13 rebotes, foi o outro destaques dos Lakers, os líderes da Conferência Oeste, com cinco vitórias e uma derrota.
Dejounte Murray somou 18 pontos e 11 rebotes pelos Spurs, Rudy Gay deixou o banco para marcar 16 pontos e DeMar DeRozan fez 14 pelo time texano, agora com quatro triunfos em seis duelos.
Quem também brilhou na rodada de domingo (3) da NBA foi Luka Doncic. O esloveno liderou os Mavericks no triunfo por 131 a 111 sobre o Cleveland Cavaliers, fora de casa, ao registrar o seu terceiro "triple-double" na temporada, sendo o segundo seguido, com 29 pontos, 14 rebotes e 15 assistências. Assim, se tornou o primeiro jogador da NBA desde Oscar Robertson em 1965 a conseguir ao menos 25 pontos, 15 assistências e dez rebotes por duas partidas consecutivas.
Kristaps Porzingis somou 18 pontos e nove rebotes, e Boban Marjanovic teve 12 pontos e oito rebotes. Os Mavericks estão com três vitórias em três jogos como visitantes, algo que não alcançava desde o campeonato de 2010/2011. Kevin Love somou 29 pontos e oito rebotes para os Cavaliers.
O Los Angeles Clippers superou o Utah Jazz, em casa, por 105 a 94, com 30 pontos e seis rebotes de Kawhi Leonard. Com um desempenho espetacular no primeiro quarto, vencido por 46 a 14, o Miami Heat bateu o Houston Rockets, em casa, por 129 a 100.
Como visitante, o Sacramento Kings derrotou o New York Knicks por 113 a 92, com 24 pontos e seis assistências de De'Aaron Fox e 22 pontos de Buddy Hield. Já o Indiana Pacers bateu o Chicago Bulls por 108 a 95, em casa, com 26 pontos, cinco rebotes e três assistências de T.J. Warren.

text:
With new LeBron triple-double, Lakers outperform Spurs
It was the 5th straight win of the Los Angeles team
04 Nov 2019, 16:45 by Estadão Contents
The Los Angeles Lakers once again relied on the brilliance of their star duo to win in the 2019/2020 NBA season. For Sunday's round (3), the team beat San Antonio Spurs 103-96 away from home with 25 points and 11 rebounds from Anthony Davis, plus 21 points, 13 assist and 11 rebounds from LeBron James.
LeBron thus regained a "triple-double", as had occurred on Friday (1), in triumph over the Dallas Mavericks, set in overtime. And Dwight Howard, with 14 points and 13 rebounds, was another highlight of the Lakers, the leaders of the Western Conference, with five wins and one defeat.
Dejounte Murray scored 18 points and 11 rebounds for the Spurs, Rudy Gay left the bench to score 16 points and DeMar DeRozan made 14 for the Texan team, now with four wins in six duels.
Luka Doncic also shone in Sunday's round (3). The Slovenian led the Mavericks in their 131-1 111 win over the Cleveland Cavaliers away from home with their third triple-double of the season, their second in a row with 29 points, 14 rebounds and 15 assists. Thus, he became the first NBA player since Oscar Robertson in 1965 to score at least 25 points, 15 assists and ten rebounds for two consecutive matches.
Kristaps Porzingis scored 18 points and nine rebounds, and Boban Marjanovic had 12 points and eight rebounds. The Mavericks have three wins in three away games, something they have not achieved since the 2010/2011 championship. Kevin Love scored 29 points and eight rebounds for the Cavaliers.
The Los Angeles Clippers beat Utah Jazz at home by 105-94 with 30 points and six rebounds from Kawhi Leonard. With a spectacular first-quarter performance, won 46-14, the Miami Heat beat the Houston Rockets at home by 129 to 100.
As a visitor, Sacramento Kings defeated the New York Knicks 113-92 with 24 points and six assists by De'Aaron Fox and 22 points by Buddy Hield. Indiana Pacers beat the Chicago Bulls 108-95 at home with 26 points, five rebounds and three assists by T.J. Warren.
